physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe diffuse abdominal pain, abdominal distention, decreased bowel sounds, rigors, and fever.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood pressure decreased to 55 / 30 mm Hg and pulse rose to 140 bpm after transfer to ICU.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hot and flushed skin, dry oral mucous membranes, decreased bowel sounds, abd distension with diffuse rebound tenderness, erythema and edema around the surgical incision.
Open abdominal wound covered by an occlusive dressing, mottled skin on flanks, fingertips and toes, diminished peripheral pulses.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Cardiac arrest occurred with subsequent treatment for worsening circulatory shock.
Blood pressure increased to 120 / 80 mm Hg and urine excretion resumed after treatment.
